question: After a rotation in the psychiatric ward, the teacher asks about the reproductive health problems of women in Pakistan. Which option best describes good reproductive healthcare practice?

answers.option: Healthy sexuality, safe pregnancy and childbearing and intended births
Social stigma, unsafe pregnancy and sexually transmitted diseases
Healthy sexuality, age related factors and intended births
Antenatal care, post natal care and child marriages

question: Which one of the following best describes the components of reproductive health?

answers.option: Health of youth, contraception, abortion, and sexually transmitted diseases
Public health, maternal health and contraception
General health of public, abortion and contraception
Maternal health, child health and diseases of females

question: Which of the following aptly defines gender?

answers.option: How a patient identifies themselves according to their roles in society

question: The health status of any individual depends on how empowered they feel at any point in time. You are assessing the perceived self-image of individuals in the community. While interviewing a poor lady, she replies that she works as a housekeeper and the employer pays a very small amount because she belongs to a minority group. Which of the following describes this condition accurately?
What is the meaning of empowerment?

A 56-year-old male is diagnosed with neurosyphilis. He never got treatment for the disease and knows nothing about the illness except for the fact that his friend told him not to tell anyone about the disease and not to visit the doctor as it is a disease that would bring shame to him. Which of the following played a major role as a barrier to seeking proper treatment?

answers.option: Lack of proper education regarding sexual and reproductive health

question: You are having a conversation with your colleagues regarding the state of reproductive health in Pakistan which includes large family size, unwanted pregnancies, and high maternal and neonatal mortality rates. Which of the following is the major factor that leads to all of this?

answers.option: Lack of education regarding reproductive health

question: Which one of the following is the major aim of imparting knowledge regarding reproductive health?

answers.option: So an individual can have broader choices in their life
To prevent the occurrence of sexually transmitted diseases
To live a more fulfilling life in terms of reproduction

question: A 15-year-old boy is brought to the psychiatry outpatient department by his parents. He reports feeling depressed since childhood and attempted to harm himself by cutting his wrists 1 month ago. He is very distressed as he has always felt like he is a girl trapped in a male body. Recently he started having thoughts of getting surgery to get his genitals changed to that of a female, which in his opinion might help him feel happy and normal. Which of the following terms best describes this disorder?

An 18-year-old female, married for 5 months presents to you in the clinic, accompanied by her husband, with complaints of non-consummation of marriage due to fear of the sexual act and intense pain whenever the couple attempts intercourse. She previously consulted a gynecologist who prescribed multivitamins and informed her that she had no gynecological problem. You diagnose her with vaginismus as a result of fear associated with intercourse. What is the best management plan in this case?

answers.option: Prescribe painkillers to be taken prior to intercourse
Prescribe a placebo to be taken prior to intercourse
Counsel the couple that there is no major problem and to keep trying
Address psychosocial correlates and provide informational care
Prescribe short-acting benzodiazepine to be taken prior to intercourse

question: A medical college student constantly feels overwhelmed and stressed about upcoming exams. She often thinks, ''I am going to fail; I am not good enough.'' What cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) technique would be most appropriate for her?
Mr. Xavier experiences a fear of public speaking, leading to avoidance of class presentations. Which cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) intervention would be most effective in addressing his fear?
What is a construct of mental empowerment?
